org.jwave.controller.editor

Interface Editor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EditorImpl

    public interface Editor
    This interface models the concept of a song editor, which allows the user to modify a song by copying, cutting and pasting together segments in order to produce a new song, which can then be saved. All "ms" acronyms stand for milliseconds.

        boolean isSongLoaded()
        Checks if a song has been loaded.
        Returns:
        true if song has been loaded, false otherwise.

      • getOriginalSongLength

        int getOriginalSongLength()
        Gets the length of the original, unmodifed song.
        Returns:
        length of original song in ms, -1 if no song loaded.

      • getModifiedSongLength

        int getModifiedSongLength()
        Gets the length of the modified song.
        Returns:
        length of modified song in ms, -1 if no song loaded.

      • setSelectionFrom

        void setSelectionFrom(int ms)
        Sets the selection-from cursor, specifying from which point the current selection begins. Also referred to as the main cursor, because of it's usage to paste copied audio.
        Parameters:
        ms - the position (in ms) where to place the cursor.

      • setSelectionTo

        void setSelectionTo(int ms)
        Sets the selection-to cursor, specifying at which point the current selection end.
        Parameters:
        ms - the position (in ms) where to place the cursor.

      • getSelectionFrom

        int getSelectionFrom()
        Gets the position of the selection-from cursor, specifying from where the current selection begins.
        Returns:
        the position (in ms) of the cursor, -1 if cursor not placed.

      • getSelectionTo

        int getSelectionTo()
        Gets the position of the selection-to cursor, specifying where the current selection ends.
        Returns:
        the position (in ms) of the cursor, -1 if cursor not placed.

      • deselectSelection

        void deselectSelection()
        Deselects both cursors, forgetting the previous selection. Done by setting both cursors (selectionFrom and selectionTo) to -1.

      • isCursorSet

        boolean isCursorSet()
        Checks if the main, selection-from, cursor is set.
        Returns:
        true if set, false otherwise

      • isSomethingSelected

        boolean isSomethingSelected()
        Checks if both the selection-from and the selection-to cursors are set, necessary condition to be able to copy or cut a piece of the currently loaded song.
        Returns:
        true if both set, false otherwise

      • copySelection

        void copySelection()
        Copies the current selection into memory.

      • getCopiedFrom

        int getCopiedFrom()
        Gets the starting point of the copied selection.
        Returns:
        the position (in ms) of the beginning of the copied selection, -1 if nothing copied.

      • getCopiedTo

        int getCopiedTo()
        Gets the end point of the copied selection.
        Returns:
        the position (in ms) of the end of the copied selection, -1 if nothing copied.

      • resetCopiedSelection

        void resetCopiedSelection()
        Forgets the copied selection, setting copiedFrom and copiedTo to -1.

      • isSomethingCopied

        boolean isSomethingCopied()
        Checks if something has been copied.
        Returns:
        true if something has been copied, false otherwise.

      • pasteCopiedSelection

        void pasteCopiedSelection()
        Pastes the currently copied selection at the main cursor.

      • cutSelection

        void cutSelection()
        Cuts the current selection, deleting it.

      • isMaxResolution

        boolean isMaxResolution(int from,
                        int to,
                        int samples)
        Checks if the gathering the asked for amount of samples for the given interval from the currently loaded song would result in groups of samples or single samples.
        Parameters:
        from - from what position (in ms) to check resolution.
        to - to what position (in ms) to check resolution.
        samples - number of segments divide interval in.
        Returns:
        true if resulting resolution is maximal, false otherwise.

      • getSimpleWaveform

        java.util.List<SimpleSampleInfo> getSimpleWaveform(int from,
                                                   int to,
                                                   int samples)
        Returns a list of values that represent the waveform of the currently loaded, and possibly modified, song. This method allows the caller to specify what segment of the song to get the waveform of, and the amount of samples to divide that segment into. The values returned are returned in groups of 2 values for each sample: one for the left channel and one for the right channel. These values represent the amplitude of the sound wave in the respective positions. All values are normalized in a -1 to 1 range.
        Parameters:
        from - from what position (in ms) to get the waveform.
        to - to what position (in ms) to get the waveform.
        samples - number of sets of values to retrieve for the asked for interval.
        Returns:
        a list of numbers representing the waveform of the modified song, in sets of 2.

      • getAggregatedWaveform

        java.util.List<GroupedSampleInfo> getAggregatedWaveform(int from,
                                                        int to,
                                                        int samples)
        Returns a list of values that represent the waveform of the currently loaded, and possibly modified, song. This method allows the caller to specify what segment of the song to get the waveform of, and the amount of samples to divide that segment into. The values returned are returned in groups of 8 values for each sample: 4 values for each audio channel (the left and right channel), of these 2 represent the maximum and minimum amplitude for that sample or group of samples, and 2 represent the root mean square of the sample or group of samples. All values are normalized in a -1 to 1 range.
        Parameters:
        from - from what position (in ms) to get the waveform.
        to - to what position (in ms) to get the waveform.
        samples - number of sets of values to retrieve for the asked for interval.
        Returns:
        a list of numbers representing the waveform of the modified song, in sets of 8.

      • printWaveform

        void printWaveform()
        Temporary debug method for printing a text representation of the waveform of the currently loaded modifiable song.

      • exportSong

        void exportSong(java.lang.String exportPath)
        Exports the modified song to the absolute path provided.
        Parameters:
        exportPath - absolute path of .wav file where song will be saved.

      • printSongDebug

        void printSongDebug()
        Temporary debug method for printing information relative to the current state of the modified song, including cuts, segments and cursors.
